revised_title: The Double Function of the Kidney and the Malpighian Bodies
tldr: The author, William Bowman, examines the structure and connections of the Malpighian bodies of the kidney in different animals. He discovers that these bodies consist of a mass of vessels within the dilated ends of the uriniferous tubes. He also finds that the blood passes through two distinct systems of capillary vessels in the kidney. Bowman proposes a theory of a double function for the kidney, based on his observations and other research.
